newsitem.title: USA: Levitt applauds PSA "pay-to-play" letter to lawyers.
newsitem.headline: Levitt applauds PSA "pay-to-play" letter to lawyers.

text.p: SEC Chairman Arthur Levitt on Tuesday applauded municipal bond dealers for urging the American Bar Association to follow their lead and adopt a voluntary ban on "pay-to-play" at an upcoming annual meeting.

"In calling for the ABA to take strong steps to end pay-to-play by lawyers, PSA points out that the integrity of the municipal bond market rests upon the shoulders of all, including lawyers," Levitt said, referring to a June 23 letter from PSA The Bond Market Trade Association to ABA President Lee Cooper.
"I applaud this call for action from those who are active in this market and have taken steps themselves to end pay-to-play," Levitt said.

SEC announced on Tuesday that Levitt will deliver a "major address later this week on the integrity of the municipal securities markets and the need to end pay-to-play by municipal securities lawyers."
He is scheduled to speak Thursday at 1230 EST (1630GMT) at the Fixed Income Conference; Wyndham Franklin Plaza Hotel Ballroom; 17th and Race Sts., in Philadelphia.
In her one-page letter to Cooper, PSA President Heather Ruth said bond dealers recognized that the muni market's integrity hinges on each dealer maintaining the highest ethical standards.
"This principle is equally applicable to other participants in the offering of municipal securities, including lawyers," Ruth said.
The ABA's Cooper was unavailable for comment.
